Notes: Pre 1950s óstán/ósdán  teach/tigh ósta/ósda in Irish
Pre-1950s bliadhain in Irish. The form bliadhna (bliana today) is used as a special plural form following numerals; the regular plural is blianta)
Also réidió and rèidio in spoken Irish and Scottish Gaelic
Pre-1950s genitive ríogh and dative rígh in Irish
In Irish  eaglais is a Roman Catholic house of worship; a Protestant house of worship is called a teampall (temple). As Gaeilge 'séipéal' is also used as it can mean chapel as well.
